Reviews.Title: “Central, breakfast, tight.”
Reviews.Author: jasperlf
Reviews.Content: Overall appearance is nice, clean. Room however, booked for 2 beds, they needed to send someone to seperate the single queen into 2 singles, which offered but 6 inches between beds. The room was small, very small; and the windows were broken and not able to open, and they refused to fix or move rooms. Bath was nice, small, with a non locking glass door. Shower was tight, shower head placed next to an angled ceiling, so I still needed to duck (I'm 5'11") to shower, and they did not offer any shower curtain. Overall, nice form, but the function part was lacking. Helpfull staff, and relatively safe, decent breakfast provided, though I wish the scrambled eggs were cooked, and not runny. Very central and walk-able to all Old City Istanbul. (As of March 2012, major subway construction next door helped us to not get any sleep some nights)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that keeps its guest happy!”
Reviews.Author: N0mad52
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed in. We were there from 13th April to 19th April. I had already informed them about my two small children so they gave us a spacious room already set with a cot and an extra bed. There was a vast variety of dishes for breakfast ranging from fruits to cereals and cheeses and egg made to your choice and many different breads. Overall, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HBurger82
Reviews.Content: Just back from a brilliant stay at Hotel Levni april 9th-13th 2012. We booked a standard double (through Expedia, about Â£110/night) but were upgraded to a deluxe double on arrival which was simply wonderful. The room was spacious, gorgeously furnished and immaculately clean. We had a view over the Bosphorous to boot. Breakfast was brilliant, a huge choice of turkish pastries/breads, cheeses, hams, fruit, cereals plus eggs,omlettes and pancakes cooked to order - and crucially available til 10.30am allowing us a nice holiday lie-in! The staff were consistently polite and helpful at all times. If i had to find fault the only thing i could say is that for me, the rule that swimming caps (available for 5 euros) must be worn to use the swimming pool put me off using it at all, but that's just my personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: Joan J
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and excellent service. My parents, my girlfriend and I stayed at Levni hotel from 9 to 12 April 2012. It was a very nice experience. Our rooms were elegantly designed and had all the amenities. The food was amazing. The staff was friendly and efficient and we enjoyed an outstanding service from the moment we arrived to the day we departed. A special mention must go to Hasan, Sedat and the breakfast maitre who made our holiday memorable. Perfect location and great value for money. Will definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The "only" place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: scottiewanderer
Reviews.Content: I am on the last day of our 10 stay in Levni and cannot wait till I get home to review this hotel. It is perfect in every aspect you would want from a hotel. Staff who are the lovliest people I have ever met who cannot do enough for you. From the moment we arrived and all during our stay we have been treated like royalty! In the restaurant Huseyin Ayaaksiz has looked after us superbly and was so kind and helpful every day. Merve is a delightful young lady who made us so welcome and thank you for your delicious special tea Merve. On the front desk everyone was fantastic especially Ozlem a wee star always bright and cheerful and welcoming. Erdem was so kind listening to our day when we returned from a trip or we were on our way aout. The room was spotless, breakfast beautifully presented every day and the hotel was perfect in every way. I enjoyed the spa facilities especially after a long day sightseeing. This was our first trip to Istanbul and the city is fabulous, vibrant and kept very clean. All restaurants we ate in and cafe's were spotless and the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque sights that will remain in our minds forever. Sadly tomorrow we go home but we will take such happy memories of all the staff at Levni. A huge big thanks from my husband and I and we will rturn some day to visit with you.

Reviews.Title: “Levni staff took good care of us”
Reviews.Author: Dohadad
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my family including a 2 and 4 year old, we booked adjoining rooms as we usually do, working with Mrs. Irem who we had read so many nice things about from other reviewers. On arrival, we were immediately impressed with the staff who were friendly and helpful from the start. Unfortunately there were a few small issues at first - there was very little floor space due to large beds in the standard size room, and the view I requested turned out to be a wall instead. Also the baby bed they brought for my son collapsed on one side with him in it, he was fine but we sent it back. I went to talk to the staff and they immediately showed me several other options for rooms and ended up upgrading us which met our needs quite well. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk from Aya Sophia and to the Bosphorous as well. It's central to everything in Sultan Ahmet really. There are shops up and down the same small road the Levni is on and you could spend a fortune in them - or just go to the Grand Bazaar which is just a few minutes walking. The staff is out of this world, they put up with our additional baggage, helped us bring our stroller in and out, doted on the kids, all with a smile. Ugur was so nice to us and the kids and wouldn't let us lift a finger. The breakfast buffet was our only meal experience in the hotel, which I would say was OK, not the best buffet but good choices for fruit and breads. The room service menu is sparse, but there are many options nearby. We didnt use the Hammam and spa on the bottom level, but the pool is nice although you have to buy a swimming cap to use it, so bring one along to save the five euros fee. The dry sauna was good, as advertised. The concierge Mrs. Erdem was amazing, friendly, helpful and gave us the best recommendation for the Sultan Ahmet Fish House which was the best meal of our trip by far. My 4 year old has already declared she wants to go back to Istanbul so I guess we will see you soon, Levni!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, new rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuddha1000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Easter weekend in Istanbul with a stay at the Levni Hotel & Spa. The hotel was well located to the Sultanahmet sites (we were considering in staying on the Bosphorus side but glad we didn't because of traffic). The hotel was a bit pricey during that time period due to the Easter holidays (true of all Sultanahmet hotels). We had an executive double room in the back wing which was nice appointed and very neat. The room was meticulously cleaned each day. The hotel staff was always ready to help with whatever we needed. One of the best part of the stay was Aydin, the concierge. She chatted with me for a half hour and not only gave me best sites to visit based upon my desires but also the most amazing restaurant suggestion (definitely go to Khorasani Restaurant). If you stay here, hunt her down because she will save you time and increase your enjoyment factor of Istanbul. The only slight negative was the wifi internet system was new but constantly knocked off my iphone and ipad. It required constantly relogging in.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: quijano
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 stayed for 4 nights in deluxe rooms. Our plane arrived later than scheduled and I called the hotel from the airport (massive queue for visas). They advised our free transfer and ensured that the minibus was waiting for us. On arrival, check in was hassle free and the guest relations manager showed us quickly around. All rooms were wonderful. Good size, comfortable beds, complimentary fruit plate and bottle of wine. A large bottle of water was also in room and replenished each day. Wifi had high speed and worked very well during our stay. We only had one problem in one of the rooms with a high temperature and obviously the thermostat wasn't working. Bathrooms were very clean, with good water pressure for showers. They had bathtubs, which may be an issue for some people with mobility problems, but for me meant that I was able to have a relaxing bath in evening!. The breakfast was delicious: orange juice appeared to be freshly squeezed, coffee and tea were good and a varied selection of pastries, cheeses, meats, eggs cooked to order - even real honeycomb! Staff during breakfast were very efficient and even though the hotel began to fill up during the latter part of our stay (Easter approaching), gave professional and rapid service. We used the spa/pool/gym a couple of times. Very handy to have in a city centre hotel. Although it opens at 10am we could call reception who would open the gym for us earlier. The marble floor in spa gets very slippery, so be aware! Staff were absolutely amazing without exception - I can't think of a hotel which I have visited where ALL staff were so genuinely trying to please the guests; from finding cushions to sit on outside whilst waiting for taxis, the cheerful "good morning" every day, good restaurant recommendations, organising last minute transport....every query or question was dealt with, with huge smiles and good humour. Even after our departure they are still being helpful; we left some photos in one of the rooms and they contacted us to advise that they would be sent in the post to us, before leaving, the guest relations manager took our photo and has sent it to us....words cannot express how delighted I am with the amiabilty of the staff and their wish for all guests to enjoy their stay in Istanbul. Location was also perfect for us on a short break. It really is in the ideal area for walking to major tourist sites, the ferries and some good restaurants (will be posting trip report on forum later). 3 days really is too short to see everything we wanted to see and all 10 of us agreed that we will be back, and obviously, to the Levni! If your rooms have no good views, go to the fire escape at back of hotel to see wonderful views of Bosphorus!

Reviews.Title: “Keep smiling you are at levni hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abdulla A
Reviews.Content: If you don't know how keep a smile on your face just stay at Levni hotel for few days and the staff will show you how.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Turnip121
Reviews.Content: This really is a great place to stay in Istanbul. My wife and I were here for 5 nights during April. The room we had reserved was small, which we knew was going to be the case based on the photos of the room. However, the amenities, including free wifi and breakfast, along with a Hamam within the hotel, drove us to book with them. After the first night, we had placed a request for an upgrade, which was granted the following morning. What an upgrade! The room was twice the size, and came with a complimentary bottle of wine and plate of Turkish pastries. And the upgrade was free. The staff are friendly and the rooms modern in design and well-appointed. The hotel itself is situated in an ideal location for Istanbul sightseeing. A 10 minute walk to the west will bring you the Spice Bazaar and Galata Bridge. A 5 minute walk to the east will bring you to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. We plan to stay here again if we find ourselves fortunate enough to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: Rubensaragih
Reviews.Content: Levni is a very nice and good hotels accommodation, with modern equipment in a very best location in Istanbul. The breakfast is various and nice. Really enjoy my stays in Levni.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nina M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our our first stop in our turkey trip. We checked in on march 24th and only stayed for 1 night before going to izmir the next day. We arrive early, arround 8 a.m and the check in was quick. We didn't know what to expect since the lobby was so small and the hotel was in a small lane, but when we got to our rooms we were immediately pleased. My friends said their rooms were differ in terms of bathroom design. I heard one friend had a semi-open bathroom that has no door that separates it from the bed room, another has doors but glass doors so it's see through from the bed. In this hotel my friends booked twin rooms, so they share the the room with 1 other, and these bathroom designs made them slightly uncomfortable. We Indonesian aren't use to such less privacy. But they eventually just laugh and make jokes about it. Soon it was thought of as one ofthose weird and funny foreign thing. My experience was different because i went with my husband. Our room was on the forth floor, big, a quite sexy room with 2 windows overlooking the rooftops of istanbul. I woke up at dusk because of jet lag, and watch the sun rised slowly from my window. I woke my husband as soon as there was little lights and he immediately grab his professional camera. It was such a pretty sight! The breakfast was wonderful, i swear i had 4 plates and finished all in minutes. The staff was courteous but the restaurant manager was most gracious! I just love how he sometimes served the guest too. You know how some hotel have strict rules in terms of breakfast? This one allows you to get another one even if you had breakfast earlier. After i went back to the room after breakfast, i came back down to the restaurant to meet my husband. I said to the manager that i had breakfast and just going in to find my husband, he said, "it's okay, you can have another one if you want to. It doesn't matter. Can i get you anything? Tea?" Anyway, i find this hotel very nice. They have pool, spa, and hamam too but i didn't get the chance to try it. The location is superb. Walking distance to everything and there's a sweet and fresh smelling bread shop in the neighborhood which made us drooled everytime we pass it. I totally recommend this hotel, but do book for a room on 4th floor and above. They have amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Levni!”
Reviews.Author: clarewood2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Levni Hotel for eight nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff - especially Ozlem in guest relations - were friendly and accomodating and full of great tips and recommendations. Our room was roomy and comfortable, the breakfasts were stupendous, and the bar is nice to chill out of an evening. Location is perfect - walking distance to most of the main attractions, plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby, the tram at the bottom of the road. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Ready to help all the time”
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by stuff's willingness to help in all my requirements. It concerns my traveling documents, taxi, advices about shopping and walking. I liked the place where the hotel is located - there is all really around. Flexible in pricing, not many people (the hotel is not big). Just what I want. Thanx a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra and get a whole lot more”
Reviews.Author: WezT
Reviews.Content: The Levni is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The bed was MASSIVE and comfy, the bath was exquisite, the location was right where we needed to be, the staff were geniunely friendly and nothing was too much trouble. There were elequant touches all around. Breakfast buffet was brilliant, with home made omlettes and pastries and lots of fruit and a crazy amount of hams and cheeses. I guess that was for the Germans, they sure do like their cheese at breakfast time. I have said 'spend a little extra' in the title because I wouldn't normally spend as much as I did on a hotel room. The Levni gets a massive 100% thumbs up from me. If you can book an executive room with a Jacuzzi then do it, you won't regret that one bit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, exceptional staff, immaculate room.”
Reviews.Author: 1ducatiboy
Reviews.Content: First class. That about sums it up! You can pay more, but I'd be hard pressed to believe that you can get a better experience. Easy walking distance to all the usual sights, a variety of restaurants are located only one street over, and the Tram stop is at the bottom of the street. We had a very roomy, immaculate, superior double, but only a fair view. However, as stated in other comments here, the location is exceptional. The made to order breakfast was a treat, and the restaurant staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. The concierge staff were both knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erikbrandt85
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at levni for 4 nights and we were very pleased with everything. The spa is actually better than you can see on the pictures which didn't convince me before leaving. Great staff, great breakfast, cosy rooms, building site (new Metro station) next to the hotel doesn't cause any inconvenience, close to blue mosque and tourist attractions. I hesitated before booking, i hope you won't because this was a great hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Definately Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: Sajid786
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Levni in joining rooms with a family of 5 during middle of February. Our 3 children had one room and we had the other. We also had my elderly parents with us on this holiday and they were given the diabled room on ground floor which was fabulous and just what they needed. The hotel is smart, clean and very well located in the heart of Instanbul, steps away from all the major sites. My parents were easily able to walk to all the sites and around the town despite their handicap. The guest relation managers are exceptionally good and it was a rela pleasure to stay there. We will definately be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: wrecksh
Reviews.Content: Slightly quirky, modern, efficient - and the staff were all just so so very friendly. Only detraction was not being able to get the free WiFi working - but probably my fault anyway. Building site opposite was never a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Levni”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is of average quality for this price range - I do not know how it compares to others in Istanbul. We stayed in a Deluxe on top floor 1501 and it was comfortable. The best thing about the Hotel is the attitude of the staff - the Manager and the front desk staff are very courteous and helpful. The breakfast lets the Hotel down a bit in this price range as the choice is not great. The massage services in the Spa are excellent. It is well loacted to the tourist sights however to get to Tacsim for food and bars you need to get a cab which can take 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nicely decorated, staff was extremely friendly, the sauna and pool were very welcome after a day spent walking through the streets of Istanbul (do not forget the bath cap). Topcapi is a 5min walk from the hotel, and all other sites are easy to reach from the hotel. Breakfast is not fantastic but still worth it. Ideal for a romantic week-end in Istanbul. We will keep a great souvenir from it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Manuel Antonio National Park, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: CRNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Levni Hotel with my parents and brother. We rented two adjoining rooms. The rooms were small but very well appointed, attractive and comfortable. The beds were especially comfortable. The hotel is very new and well designed and built. The staff was the best part, with the two guest relations managers both extremely helpful and friendly. They made us feel at home right away and were always ready with a smile and great advice. The onsite spa, in the lower level is also very well done and free to guests. The sauna and Turkish Bath rooms were great, and the pool, although I didnÂ´t use it looked great and many other guests used it. They have a nice fitness room as well, which I didn't use. We also got a couple of treatments in the Turkish Bath which I enjoyed, though you can have a great time at the spa without them. The location in the old city is also terrific, in walking distance from all the major attractions. You can also take a cab or public transportation to the new part of the city and have a wonderful walk back to the Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul as a tourist and wanting to stay in the old city. I feel that for the price it was a great value too, at least in the off season when we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: EddyKGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: My friends a young couple and I stayed here for two weeks starting 15th February 2012. I am of Turkish origin, but it is not immediately obvious and I am exceptionally tall for a Turk. I make the point because I found the staff very polite, respectful, and genuinely pleased to be of assistance wherever possible both before and after they became aware of my ethnicity. This was a not a show for the tourists, it was genuine warmth and Turkish hospitality of the most sincere kind, as one may expect to experience from staying with friends or family! Reception staff were helpful with directions, pointing out locations on maps, and anything we asked for. We were provided with complimentary tea, coffee, and large bottled water daily. We used the pool, sauna, and gym which although compact were nevertheless very well maintained and an enjoyable experience all at no extra charge. The rooms are spacious and stylish, well equipped with modern fittings. The breakfast buffet is very comprehensive, choice of boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, wedges, sausages, omelettes, cereals, dried and fresh fruits, cheeses, fresh vegetables olives, jams, yoghurts, croissants, pain au chocolate, and bread and pastries of many varieties and more, we all ate like royalty! We were having late nights and most days we went for breakfast at 10am only half an hour before it ends, but never once were we hurried or made to feel unwelcome. I would like to say a special thank you to Huseyin the service manager and Eyup on the service team for all their kind hospitality and assistance - we all look forward to returning here soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MikeMassingham
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Istanbul at the Levni Hotel. Location was excellent and 10 minutes walk from anywhere in the historic area and very close to the Tram to get up to Taksim Square. The staff were friendly and helpful and even had a birthday cake put in our room for my Wife's birthday which was a lovely suprise. It is opposite a construction site at the moment but we couldn't hear any noise at night. It is also close to a Mosque which woke us up at 5am each morning but I guess most hotels in the historic area were so it didn't really bother us.Hotel was clean and the sauna, turkish bath and pool facilities were great to come back to after a days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.....!!!”
Reviews.Author: GbPaul
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading various reviews on trip advisor and it did not disappoint! Thank you so much to the wonderful staff at the Levni for making our stay at their hotel so pleasurable.The staff were always on hand to help you and were very polite and happy. From the receptionists on the front desk, to the waiters and even the restaurant staff. Most of all big thanks to Ozlem & Erdem. What lovely people - service with a smile! The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and very modern. Location was fantastic - everything was easily reached and was within walking distance of the main sights. Highly recommneded and good value for money. Thanks again Levni! Paul & Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Very clan and very good staff...”
Reviews.Author: MyCouncil
Reviews.Content: ...Clean with a very good staff. Everything has been excellent. It is on a beautifull location and there is a beautifull spa very usefull for our pre dinner relaxing time. I could never say something bed of my stay there.Very good job guys!!! We miss you. Gabry & Ketty.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Marita9999
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul with another couple for a weekend break in February. I knew that we had chosen well with the Levni Hotel when the taxi company we used for our airport transfers said 'good choice!' The rooms were modern and bright and the huge bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The staff were superb - we were only in Istanbul for 2 nights, and they recommended excellent restaurants to us both nights. They also helped with a booking to see the Sema Ceremony of the Whirling Dervishes, and with the best places to go for nightlife. The location of the hotel is ideal - a short walk away from the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque and the Basillica Cistern. The only time we had to take a taxi was to venture over to the Asian side of the city, for our night out. We didn't use the spa during our stay, but we did have a look around - the pool is very small but the facilities are good and clean, and again, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: Joel R
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews of the Levni hotel prior to booking our trip, and were influenced by the positive things we read. Great service is a phrase that is often overused, however all the staff at the Levni surpassed our expectations, from the Porter who carried our bags, to the waiters who served our breakfast, to the breakfast omelette chef who made sure we were well fed, right through to the incredible guest relations team. I was travelling with both young children and elderly parents, who were entranced by the genuine warmth and affection received. In all my years traveling abroad I have never encountered such sincere people, who were pleased to assist you at every turn. A special mention must go to Ozlem who made my children feel so special, and ensured we ate at only the finest restaurants, to Erdem for his constant attention and to the breakfast staff who won over my father in law, no mean feat!! The hotel was perfectly positioned for our needs, in close proximity to the old town, the rooms were as you would expect with a modern feel, and the swimming pool perfect for a four & seven year old who just wanted to have fun. When leaving the hotel you actually felt a sense of melancholy as you were saying goodbye to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller886
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels I stayed in. Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice design. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shel64
Reviews.Content: The Levni Hotel was very comfortable, clean with very helpful and friendly staff. It is very reasonably priced, in an excellent location with the most friendly and helpful staff. The staff are particularly helpful, they all seem to speak reasonable or good English and were extremely courteous and prompt in responding to all our requests. They gave great advice on trams, eating out, and even e-checked us onto our return flight home. Excellent! The rooms were modern and nicely decorated without being lavish; the beds very comfortable, decent sized and you can choose your type of pillow! and a decent shower room. (Although, note, for the more sensitive, the in-room bathroom/toilet door is transparent). Our family of four had a two room â€˜setâ€™ (1101 & 1102) which was very convenient and private. The rooms were quiet despite the central location and, at the time of our stay the Mamara tunnel project being underway in the vicinity. The clean and bright free Spa, fitness room and swimming pool (swim hat obligatory) were enjoyed during our scant free time although my sporty offspring found the pool very small. The food is good and dining room was bright and fresh with decent food and a good selection of healthy breakfast choices. There is little in the way of a â€˜lounge areaâ€™ although there is a small cafÃ© and two reception areas. This is very much a city hotel for active â€˜site seersâ€™. The hotel itself is located very conveniently and centrally in a small cobbled street and looks deceptively small from the outside; the interior has been highly modernised, negotiating its way across different buildings and levels whilst the decor inside is clean and modern. The Levni is a short walk from all the top sites â€“ Topkapi Palace, Haihia Sophia, Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque, Basilica Cistern and downhill to the Spice Bazaar, Eminonu port and Galata bridge. The Grand Bazaar is a little further to walk but there are two Tram stops within 200m which will take you to the latter or across Galata bridge to the Tunel, Dolmabahce Palace, Istanbul Modern etc. The tram is very convenient and easy to use - pay machines at each stop return a 2 Lira plastic jeton for coins or notes. We eat out most evenings â€“ there are many options nearby and, again, the hotel staff were extremely helpful in suggesting some very good reasonably priced and varied options. We thought this an excellent hotel for a city break for a few days or a week and suited our teenagers well. The staff themselves were great and really helped us to make the most of our stay. We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...long live Levni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: panditjee
Reviews.Content: I picked Levni based on some good reviews on TripAdvisor. I expected the hotel to be good. But, I must admit that Levni was beyond all our expectations. From the beautifully appointed rooms, excellent complimentary breakfast buffet to the friendly staff, Levni charmed us unlike any other hotel we have every stayed in. Levni is located within a short walk from the Gulhane tram stop. Most must-see sight-seeing places are within a short distance by foot or tram. There are good restaurants all over the place. We have been to many hotels over the years around the world, but we never felt as welcome as at Levni, If we go back to Istanbul, we are definitely going to choose Levni. Hats off to the chef at the restaurant and his assistant, Merve. Many thanks to Ozlem, the guest relations manager who treated our daughter like a princess. Levni provides excellent pick up and drop off service from the airport at a reasonable cost. Levniâ€™s staff makes the hotel a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kensky1003
Reviews.Content: All hotel staff are very friendly. Even cleaners asked us if they could help us when we were trying to find the spa. Room was clean and discreet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Levni hotel”
Reviews.Author: Javier Z
Reviews.Content: We had four fantastic days with my wife and my cousins. Levni staff were so kind with us. Service is very good quality and rooms were very clean and so nice. The situation of the hotel is particularly good. My regards for Ozlem for her support and help to contract the guide and for her kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & even better staff - perfect for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: um358
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel LEVNI at the beginning of February 2012 with my young family, teenage cousins and parents and the hotel was a joy to stay in. It is situated in the old town area of Istanbul and we found it only 10 minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Church/Museum, Archaeological Museum, Topkapi Palace Museum & Grand Bazaar. It is also close to the tram system and taxis are regularly parked at the end of the street. Situated in a small cobbled street, the hotel looks deceptively small from the outside - but the decor and finish inside is modern, clean and Arabian chic. We received a warm welcome on arrival (hotel transfer was arranged by the hotel at a cost), and we booked the only Dublex room in the hotel. Our fellow travelers stayed in a standard double, (which was an excellent size with lovely decor), a large double, (where they were able to include a single fold out bed) with balcony and the Boshorus Suite (which was simply stunning) with views of the Boshorus, and major attractions. The rooms are lovely and clean and have mini bars and hotel safes. Breakfast is included with all rooms and offers a great selection for families. The hotel offers free use of the SPA (except massages) an excellent cafe and restaurant. The biggest asset this hotel boasts is its staff. Turkey is known for its hospitality anyway, but the team in LEVNI are courteous, honest, reliable and go the extra mile. We dealt with the hotel directly via email as our room requirements did not suit normal booking agent options and they were quick and met all of our requirements. We dealt with Irem and Oslem and I would recommend that every potential guest speaks to them before booking - they are truly excellent at meeting requirements and following special instructions. Just have patience with slightly broken english and you will be rewarded. Don't succumb to the allure of the 5 star hotels in Istanbul. Almost all of them are nowhere near the attractions, and this hotel is right up there with the best of them. I can't rate our stay in the hotel high enough. You should not be disappointed. Reading my tips is a must!! Well done LEVNI.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Touristy Hotel near Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Bukovitz
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul on business, and it is very rare I take a break anywhere to see-the-sights. However, on this trip I had an extra day before departure, so I decided to pick a hotel in Sultanahmet. Given my last-minute plans, almost every hotel was booked full in Sultanahmet, and I ended up at the Levni by surfing Tripadvisor. I paid a premium for the room, because apparently lots of Germans were in town for a football match. The staff at the Levni are exceptional, even for Turkey where the level of service in the hospitality industry is always way above average. The breakfast here (included with my room) was also very good, with many healthy-lifestyle choices. The floor plan was a bit convoluted, but that is to be expected in these older Sultanahmet buildings from what I could tell. To get to my room, I had to cross outside briefly (but still within the Levni building), and then find the elevator. My driver (who works on retainer for my company) was not familiar with navigating at night in Sultanahmet, so it took some time for him to find the hotel. There is absolutely no parking outside; again, normal for this touristy area. When my driver stopped to drop me off at the hotel entrance, he blocked other cars behind him on the narrow street; characteristic of the Turks, they all started learning on their car horns. They love their car horns here more than any place in Europe, but are still bush-league compared to the drivers in India, Egypt, or Indonesia (the top three on my global Worst Drivers list). Anyway, back to the hotel . . . What impressed me most about this remodeled hotel was the cleanliness. The room and the bathroom (small by global standards, but large by Euro standards) were squeaky-clean. The large windows in my room overlooked the Bosphorus, so I woke up to see a beautiful sunrise and a big cruise ship coming into dock on the Asian side of Istanbul. Unlike hotel windows in *#$&%# American hotels which are terrified of lawsuits, these windows could be opened. I had some WiFi issues here, and the signal I got was weak and slow; the hotel needs to install more repeaters and/or upgrade to 802.11n. I cleared the small desk off for work but could not get a decent signal from the desk. I ended up doing my emails sitting on the bed, because I got a stronger WiFi signal there. If there was a business center, I didn't see it; I printed my boarding pass by sending it to the hotel's fax machine. I never visited the spa; not my thing, because spas make me feel like a tossed salad :) But just looking at the brochures, my wife would have liked the hotel spa. Being that I was at this hotel explore Sultanahmet, I liked my choice. But there is no way I would recommend this hotel - - or any hotel in Sultanahmet for that matter - - for business travelers, other than the old prison (Four Seasons). This place is tourist-all-the-way. So if you're here to see Sultanahmet and want a very good hotel staff, I don't think you can go wrong with the Levni.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & fantastic persons”
Reviews.Author: Albert01967
Reviews.Content: Been there for holiday the place is gorgeous and the service is really super! The Spa is really nice and staff prepared and very professional. Food has been a real surprise! Will surely suggets to friends. The atmosphere of Istanbul is special, it has been the first time in that city but will go back and spend some more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service!”
Reviews.Author: IAH88
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Levni Hotel for 3 nights in January. It was my spouse's birthday, so I contacted the hotel in advance to request flowers in the room with a note for a little birthday surprise. The Guest Relations contact (Ozlem) promptly replied to my email and was extremely friendly. When we arrived, the surprise was beyond any expectations. There were flowers, a small cake, and many details all over the room, balloons on the bed, little hearts by the jacuzzi, and our initials in the bathroom. Ozlem and the rest of the staff were very attentive and all requests were promptly attended. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are well appointed. Hotel is also in a great location. However, it is not without its flaws: 1) The pool, gym, and sauna at the spa were fantastic. However, the Turkish bath was a bit overpriced and not as enjoyable. I would suggest visiting one of the local Turkish baths that are not attached to a hotel. 2) At check out, hotel expenses had to be paid in cash in either Euro or Turkish Lira. This is a bit of an inconvenience because I had to find an ATM and take out a large sum, and paying ATM fees, instead of using my credit card which has no foreign fees. For a 4 star hotel, I would expect to be able to pay with a credit card. I would have given the hotel a 4.5 overall, but I think that the service was so absolutely outstanding that I went for a 5 instead of a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Superb !”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Levni,with 2 children,just the beginning of 2012. HEre is what we'd experienced during our stay; very warm welcome on the reception.Kind and smiley crew making you feel special. Continuously helping people around you anytime you need help. All this and more,made us feel very special. Hassan,Onor,Inan all made their best in order to provide us a better comfort which we have never seen this level. Location,rooms,breakfast,spa all perfect. We suggest every istanbul visitors to try this friendly,pleasant hotel. Warm Regards

Reviews.Title: “A great, modern and comfortable hotel walking distance to Istambul's main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Fbessone
Reviews.Content: A great, modern and comfortable hotel walking distance to Istambul's main attractions. The staff is very nice and helpful. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: keda001
Reviews.Content: Levni defintely lived up to our expectations. Situated in Sultanahmet with walking distance to most of the interesting places, and close to the tramway and ferries. The hotel was fresh and the staff was very friendly and helpful. An extra plus for the brithday cake they suprised us with! Wonderful guesture.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not really a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: athensfan
Reviews.Content: Location: Well located in the old city (Sultanahmet). Aya Sofia, TopKapi, the Spice bazaar, the blue Mosque and the Grand bazaar are within walking distance. Also, a tramway station is only a 5 minute walk away. Only disadvantage is the construction site just outside the hotel that did not bother us as all rooms are soundproof. Rooms: we got a standard double room which is big enough for two persons with nice modern decoration. The only thing that we did not like was the fact that the window was very small hence the light would barely get into the room. Service and breakfast: Service was good with the personnel at the reception speaking english with no real issue. Breakfast also nice apart from the section with the croissants, the cakes, etc. Spa center: I went down to the spa center for a foam massage. Overall the health center is small with a small swimming pool and a very small gym room. The hamam is fine with no thrills. Do note that the health center is located in the underground section of the hotel so no natural light there.

Reviews.Title: “Special Service @ Hotel Levni”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. The service we received was on all levels we've experienced before. This hotel has character. We had an executive suite, very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Location is great within walking distance to old city. Its hard to beat this wonderful place. Hope to see again this city and our new friends at levni. xx

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home!”
Reviews.Author: filo d
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit and feel Old City, you should stay Levni. As they say on check-in process, you can just call "0". Everybody is ready to help you! I follow all comments. The construction is beyond their power. They can't do anything.Contrary you can see Ottoman treasure underground.You have a great turkish breakfast. Thanks for wonderful greeting of reception staff, thanks for great information and smile of guestrelation lady.We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unpredictable Service Quality”
Reviews.Author: Bpav73
Reviews.Content: It's my 2nd visit to Istanbul after 20 years. I couldn't believe my eyes that Istanbul has turned into a beautiful & modern city... I loved the old city district. I stayed in otel levni 5 nights. I was not expecting this level service quality. Staff is making you feel like you've rented all the hotel or you are the owner of the hotel. Unpredictable service quality!!! Thanx for all...

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and price”
Reviews.Author: BeaMondi
Reviews.Content: Ottimo hotel con ottima posizione per visitare i principali punti di interesse. Il personale e' sempre molto disponibile.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: aytonsprint
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the best hotel staff ever, headed by Ozlem who has to be the most fun, intelligent and professional hotel employee we have ever met. The location is wonderful for tons of the "must sees" of Istanbul, and the room, if small, was comfortable, clean and quiet, especially for such a central location. Breakfast great with good choice and good quality and the friendliest chef of all time. Had a lovely massage but total spa experience not my favourite. Would use this hotel again for a return trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “On the level of our high expectation”
Reviews.Author: jdneves
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on the very good comments on this site, and it was according to our expectations. Despite of the old constructions of this area of the city, this is a new building. Has large and beutiful rooms, with nice views. The only point not good is that we have some stairs between the elevator and room, but this was no problem to us. Breakfest also very good, like most in Turkey, with indoor and outdoor table. Located 2 blocks from the light train station, and c. 4 blocks to the Topkapi Palace. Walkind distance to most of main turistic places. There is a construction of the new metro station right in front of the hotel, so I believe within maybe in a year, is going to have also this easy transportation. Nice staff, the hotel was very busy and peolple was attention. Unfortunately we didtÂ´t have time for the spa. This was a great experience, I would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “''Very good hotel,very professional reception staff''”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nighy very good location near to the historical area. ten minute to walk blue mosque,topkapi palace,St. Sophia,grand bazaar.very easy to use public transportation. Hotel is new and modern breakfast good.The point is staff; they are ready to help you at any time they just want to make you happy. i would highly recommend this hote. thanks to all reception staff again...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ma G
Reviews.Content: I was there for 2 days. Was a real good experience, all the staff was efficient and friendly. I enjoy food at the restaurant and the spa. I will defenetly go back to Levni hotel in my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: Christine K
Reviews.Content: The staff are welcoming, friendly and engaging. The location was perfect, we were in beautiful Istanbul, and we didn't want to leave the hotel - and that's the truth! The room was beautiful, the restaurant/food traditional and western - the best quality (the turkish coffee for a non-coffee drinker was addictive). The staff is what defined this hotel for us. Me and my patner cannot say enough about it. We will definatly be coming back next year..... Graham and Christine

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Levni, great location, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: 007London2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Levni in December 2011 for 9 days. The staff are all, without exception, excellent, helpful, and friendly. A great staff team, and charming to be welcomed each morning by Zekerya and his freshly cooked omlettes with a big smile. Comfortable rooms, good service, access to internet, relaxing spa. The location was excellent for Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Sophia. Close to Spice Market and transport to other parts of the city. 35 minutes from the airport. There is some building work taking place in Istanbul, but this didn't affect our stay. I found the hotel to be quiet at night, apart from the gentle alarm of the call to prayer, although early, added to the magic of this fascinating and fun city. Thank you all at the Hotel Levni for making my holiday so easy and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Levni Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Anna Nicholas C
Reviews.Content: Ä° was at Levni with my husband in november. Ä°t was a great stay! We prefered hotel transfer, which was well arranged. The reception staff met us so friendly. They were professional and gave so many information. From guestrelations to reception everything was fantastic! At breakfast the chef cooked delicious fresh egges yummiiii! Hotel has a huge Spa center,compare with the neighboord hotels. The weather was fine,it was cold but no rain. Our room cleaned daily we will be back next year in november

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Cairn07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Levni Hotel & Spa recently for a Corporate Training Weekend. The standard of service was exemplary and only matched by the well maintained and beautifully designed rooms, which featured great views over the old city and the Bosphorous, chic marble bathrooms and quality fittings throughout. Breakfasts were equally appealing with a great selection of local treats and pastries, freshly prepared omelettes and so on. We look forward to our next stay with anticipation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to be, great people working, very good quality”
Reviews.Author: mgnviolin
Reviews.Content: I stay with my Family at Levni hotel the first weekend of 2011, I really recomend the hotel, it is very well located, all the important things to see and visit are very closed walking. At the other hand there it is a spa, with free worm simming pool, you feel really well after a long day walking, also they have turkish sauna. The people working there are fantastic, special atention Mrs. Ã–zlem GÃ¼ndogdu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence Continues !!!”
Reviews.Author: drtonyukuk
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to all historical places like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia,Topcapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar...... Good view of the Marmara sea and Princess islands from the terrace... Clean and cozy rooms, the staff is very friendly and helpfull, they make you feel at home, especially Ozlem and Bahri they are so nice, they will give you all information you need about istanbul and Turkey. I really enjoyed my time there. it was a good choise

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: danmati
Reviews.Content: Good location, Very nice and friendly stuff, from room maid to top management. Very clean rooms, many TV channels, good breakfast animated by a nice chef preparing fresh cooked eggs. Minor observations: some windows don't close tight so that could result in some street noise; lack of toilet brush ("hotel concept" - was the explanation); every two days the card key to access the room didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Citytrip”
Reviews.Author: Dirk K
Reviews.Content: Levni hotel is ideal situated in the old city near all major attractions. Always check your rates as if you book direct for min 3 nights a free transfer from the airport is included. Nice and beatifull wellness and swimingpool (need a swimmingcap). Certainly to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgence, serenity, prime location, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: lbdgt
Reviews.Content: The Levni hotel spans over two interconnected buildings, recently renovated with quality materials. The ambience is understated luxury, our standard room was decorated in rich yet restful colours, quality soft furnishings and linens, with a large bathroom and large windows looking out onto a pedestrianised zone to the rear of the building. Five minutes walk to either the Galatta Bridge or Topkapi. Breakfasts were unhurried and plentiful and spa treatments were well executed though somewhat more expensive than expected. The one weak spot was evening meals in the restaurant. Well-intentioned though rushed service, many menu items not available, uninspired cooking. But scores of restaurants can be found only minutes away. Overall, we were impressed by hotel Levni and would stay again when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Ghariba B
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcomed in Levni. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the decoration was fantastic. The location of the hotel is perfect, everything you need to see is nearby the hotel. And our little girl (they called her princess) got a lot of atantion. We will visit Istanbul again in the future and we will sure stay at Levni again.

Reviews.Title: “BOSPHORUS RELAX”
Reviews.Author: emilio c
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to sleep again in the excellent suite on the top floor with view on Bosphorus, Blue Mosque and Corn d'Or. Room service fast and efficient, very good traditional fish and vegetables at the inside restaurant with tasty Turkish red wine. Worm welcome and qualified service at the SPA. I was in Istanbul for business and the location between downtown and the airport is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What a special place full of very special people!”
Reviews.Author: Liza P
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul in July for the very first time and stayed at the Levni Hotel for 2 nights. What a very pleasant and wonderful suprise to experience such amazing hospitality and such wonderful warm treatment by management and staff. We never wanted for anything and nothing was ever too much to ask, so we fell totally in love with Levni and the staff. 3 names immediately springs to mind as those who made our stay a very memorable one: Hussein, Kamber and Serkin - what wonderful people! Needless to say...we went back during November and stayed for 4 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, well located”
Reviews.Author: SydneyEsgirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very early morning flight and had arranged, and re-confirmed,transfers from the airport to the hotel. They were not there. Probably not so bad in the end, as taxi was cheaper than price quoted from Hotel. As it was too early to check in to our rooms, we were welcome in the breakfast area until we could go out and visit sights. Standard rooms were smartly decorated and spotless. After visiting Ephesus for a couple of days we returned to the Levni and were upgraded to Deluxe rooms which were lovely EXCEPT the shower could not be used in one bathroom as it flooded the whole area and the taps could only be reached by standing in the bath. The bath surrounds in the bathrooms were too wide, a person with mobility problems would have difficulty getting in and out. Breakfast was very good, staff were helpful. Spa was enjoyable, Turkish hamam experience highly recommended. Hotel kindly took us to the airport without charge when we left, in compensation for not being there on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, don't be fooled by the exterior!”
Reviews.Author: coopermanloose
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night prior to departing from Istanbul on a cruise. The hotel entrance is quite small but you will be pleasantry surprised when you get past the reception area. Take the lift and the hotel goes up as well as back. Outside the hotel is a bit grim as they very close to a constuction site. It was a public holiday the days we were there and we had no adverse affects from the site. There are several budget restaurants close to the hotel. The room was excellent, a lot of space and well decorated. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom modern and spacious. The breakfast was buffet style. The selection of hot and cold was excellent and the staff were helpful. We did not use the leisure facilities but the pool looked inviting. The location of the hotel is good for sightseeing, fairly close the some of the major tourist spots. The reception staff were very helpful. Be careful with taxis, we did hear of one couple getting short changed.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent for visiting historical attractions and good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Stein H
Reviews.Content: We were two couples visiting Istanbul, and we were all very impressed with the hotel. Location is excellent, so is the spa and the restaurant recommendation from the Guest Relations Supervisor was outstanding. A boat trip with the public transportation across Bosporus is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Levni !!”
Reviews.Author: SADEK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Levni with my wife from 17 to 20 November! I travel frequently and this is the first time I meet such level of customer service! Guest relations staff, the technical staff as well as the reception and the breakfast team are all in trouble for you to be fully satisfied! It deserves 5 â€‹â€‹stars hotel in both the service provided that the hotel services that is to say the room and breakfast! At the end of our stay the management gave us a gift in addition to birthday cake for my wife as well as the fabulous decor of the room! When I go back to Istanbul is definitely in Levni Hotel would go! A wonderful hotel to advise all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrhman A
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel seems poor from the outside, it's so clean and new from the inside. Rooms are SUPER and comfortable. They have good Spa where you can have the traditional Turkish bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrye63
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from a week's vacation in Istanbul & Cappadocia. The hotel was very attentive to any and all requests. Concierge was great with restaurant recommendation. The hotel is very well located within walking distance of the main historical attractions in the old city and has numerous restaurants and cafes nearby. Both the Grand Bazaar & Spice markets are a short stroll (5 minutes). We would highly recommend this hotel for its amenities, cleanliness and attentiveness. Much more initimate than any grand luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha T
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed at the levni and we were really pleased with all aspects of the accommodation. Two of our rooms were small but the children had a much larger room. The service was superb, my father became ill during our trip and ended up in hospital and the staff could not do enough to help, they were excellent. They were helpful, kind and made a potentially stressful event, far less so, I can not speak highly enough of them all, especially the gorgeous young woman, whose name has escaped me, at reception. The position is great, very central and easy to get around, tram is just around the corner, and the breakfasts were also really good and a great start to the day. The rooms were clean and modern. A wonderful city and a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: coco_chan99
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean room, friendly staff and nice breakfast. Especially the chef was very nice and friendly. I liked his omelet. When I wanted to learn how to make it, he taught me and asked me to cook by myself. It was a great experience in Istanbul. Thank you so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: MORA M
Reviews.Content: I was at the Levni Hotel this weekend , with my husband and a group. We simply loved the hotel , it is very wel located, the facilities and design are great, we wre lucky to have also access to spa , hamman : ) The staff was just so nice, very careful to every detail and very welcoming. They made us feel like at home ! A big thank to Kamber "the strong turkish" barman who was really helpful, nice and who gave us very nice tips. A huge thank also to the wonderful Ozlem who was the perfect host and welcomed our group so nicely, always smiling she even offered us a present for being a newly married couple ! Thank you all for the very nice weekend at your place. A good representation of the hospitality of Turkish people

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Levni!”
Reviews.Author: Mpl17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Levni Hotel for 2 nights with my mom and baby brother. Everyone was so friendly and attentive, especially to the little one. There are free buffet style breakfasts, which were great! Eggs and pancakes made to order, as well as fruit, cheese, olives, yogurt, bread, and more. The hotel is very modern and clean, and our room was very nice and comfortable. The spa was also great- I highly recommend the Turkish bath! The hotel is inside 2 different buildings, so we had to take 2 elevators to get to our room- a little confusing but not a big deal. The only drawbacks I can think of were that the Airport Shuttle was rather expensive, and swimcaps for the pool cost 5 euro (it would be nice if they were provided). Oh, and our room didn't have a clock, which would have been a nice addition. Overall, however, I highly recommend this hotel. It is within walking distance to many sites, and there are cute shops and restaurants nearby. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Levni Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Merlin3977
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this hotel having been cruising around the Mediterranean and black sea. Having got off the cruise ship in Istanbul I decided to take a few days off to soak up the atmosphere of Istanbul. Having spent an age looking for just the right place to stay I decided upon the Levni based upon the reviews on this site and have to say that I am impressed. For a relatively new hotel to get just about everything right is a bit of a rarity, given that I travel a lot for business. The staff are helpful, courteous and friendly to a fault. In fact they come across as people you could become friends with. The common areas of the hotel are superb and the rooms are right up there with the standard of the five star hotels I spend a lot of time in in Singapore, the middle east and Asia as a whole. If you're looking for a first class hotel with first class service close to all the top attractions in Istanbul, then you'd be mad to go anywhere else. The Levni is superb and coming from me that is high praise indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely flawless. Excellent service, location, amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra C
Reviews.Content: The experience was absolutely flawless. I had the pleasure of receiving an extremely personalised and customised service that was above and beyond anything I have experienced in the hotel industry before. The location and the rooms were also splendid but I would like to congratulate the whole staff on my very warm and hospitable stay, and a special mention has to go to Oezlem and Bahri, responsible for guestrelations. Both were fantastic hosts, Oezlem went out of her way to make sure, that my needs were met, she is an immense asset to this hote, who genuninely loves her job and with it her guests. Bahri can only say 'yes' to all guest requests (and mine were plenty!! :-)) thanks again, I'll be back, if only to stay with you guys, and see you again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Levni Hotel & Spa in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Stale S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Levni Hotel for one whole week and was absolutely trhilled by the kindness, hospitality and good care provided to us by all of the staff at this wonderful hotel. Being a family with two small children was a pure pleasure at this hotel. Our two little girls were given so much attention they felt like princesses all the time during our stay and they started calling the hotel staff their friends. I sincerely must say I've never stayed at a hotel were so much personal attention has been provided. Regarding the location of the hotel this is super for exploring all of Istanbul. Just a short walk from all the major attractions like Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basillica Cisterns, etc. In addition good tramways and kind help from the hotel on taxi-bookings also made us see more distant parts of Istanbul like the new part of town, the shopping mecca Nisantasi, the cosy restaurants along the Bosphorous, the finance districts of Maslak and Levent, etc. And, last but not least, the food on the hotel was absolutely delightful. The breakfast was supreme - the chef made omelets for the adults and pancakes for the children every morning. The dinners were supreme and the chef really also did everything the children asked for - cooking plates that was not even on the meny (like making pide instead of ordinary round pizza when the children wanted a "boat shaped pizza". We have absolutely NOTHING to complain of regarding our stay. Clean, bright and big rooms. WONDERFUL staff and delightful meals. Perfect location. If you need a good advice for a perfect stay in Istanbul - well then we'll recommend Levni Hotel. A choice you will not regret and a stay you will remember. Best regards, the Sando family

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anh D
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel close to everything. Room is nice, clean and hotel is overall great. It is very modern so for those that prefers the rustic/antique type of decor you may not like it. Service was great especially at Breakfast. The chef that makes the eggs every morning was so nice and friendly. Breakfast selection is very good and plentiful. Had a great time in Istanbul and hotel is overall very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and lovely hotel make for a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren F
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Turkey for a five day family holiday. Traveling with two small children (ages 2 and 4) can be an experience in and of itself, it turns out that Turkey was an amazing choice and picking the Levni Hotel made it even MORE so! We arrived to very friendly staff who immediately made us feel at home.They were so eager to make our stay as nice as possible that they showed us 3 different hotel rooms and let us pick the one that suited us best! From Ozlem, one of the nicest people I have ever met, to Bahri (equally as lovely), to the super-sweet chef at breakfast who ALWAYS remembered how we liked our eggs, the Levni Hotel made us feel like family from start to finish. Along with a great staff, the indoor pool and Turkish bath were nice amenities. The location is perfect, walking distance to good restaurants, easy access to public transportation and close to all the major historical attractions. It was the perfect place to stay and we definitely plan on staying there again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aggeliki V
Reviews.Content: Levni hotel is in a very good position in Istanbul from where you can visit Ayia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar and many other sites on feet!!! Very close distances!! Our room was luxury, modern, with a very comfort bed, shiny and very clean!!! We had a "Kings Breakfast" and also a great great dinner!!! The Spa area was a unique experience and the staff of the spa was so helpful and kind!!! Last but not least the best of all was the staff of the Hotel!!! All of them are amazingly helpful and kind persons!!! We will definitely visit Levni Hotel again!!!! Everything and everyone was absolutely PERFECT!!!!!! We recommend you to visit Levni and have a wonderful holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very convinient place with good spa!”
Reviews.Author: Redbutton_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because it emphasizes the spa they have. It turnt out to be not disappointing at all! We went to the sauna several times during our a week's stay, also tried the Hamams n massage! The staff were very friendly n we had a nice time there. The standard rooms we originally book were a bit small for our taste. At the third night, the hotel switched us to a delux room, which was just nice! One thing not too pleasant was the construction sites at both sides of the hotel, which can get a bit lousy sometimes, having said that, the hotel is truely a plus with the prime location, newly renovated n smart sensor controled systems, not to mention the excellent services!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food and staff”
Reviews.Author: YRok
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1night but could know Levni hotel is outstanding and very right choice. Major historic sights are within few minutes walk and tram is even near. Breakfast is fantastic and chef makes fantastic omelet. A small supermarket locates only next door.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place wit many "but"..”
Reviews.Author: FabrizioOsti82
Reviews.Content: Positive points: Perfect location, perfect reception service, perfect rooms quality, good bathrooms, not so good quality of the breakfast service, since almost no one could speak English good enough to understand correctly our requests, and even to let us understand what they were telling us. In the toilet the brush was missing... Negative points: Bosphorus view: I booked a room with view on the Bosporus, but it was hardly to be seen; this fact has really disappointed me, since I had booked this hotel that promised a perfect sea view, but all I could see was the fire stair, and far in a corner a small piece of sea! Last, but the worst part of our stay at this beautiful hotel was the transfer to the airport sabiha gÃ¶kcen; you left us in the hands of a crazy driver, who couldn't even speak one word in eglish, who almost crashed us against the highway payment barrier, since he didn't have the automatic charging system! Me and my girlfriend were shocked by this awful experience, and I would like to remind you that we payed 75â‚¬ for this transfer, almost the double of the normal fare rate charged by a locak taxi driver, who charged us 110Â£ for the incoming transfer! All that said I'm still sure I would suggest anyone to take this hotel for a visit of Istanbul! Fabrizio

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: escargot748
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Levni Hotel was a highlight of our trip to Istanbul. We stayed at another nice hotel for the first 2 nights, but had comfort issues with the pillows, so checked out & booked same day at the Levni. The lovely gentleman at reception on arrival noted that my husband was tall, & was kind enough to upgrade us to a superior room with king bed. The decor of the room was luxurious & had all of the comforts one would expect of a top quality hotel. Buffet breakfast the following day was delicious & I particularly liked the omelette station with a chef cooking to order as you waited. I enjoyed a massage in the hotels well appointed spa facility after breakfast & it was dreamy. The hotel is well located in a nice area only a few minutes walk from Topkapi Palace & other major attractions. The service from all of the staff was excellent, management are to be congratulated on their training.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an amazing location, customer service just needs tweeking”
Reviews.Author: Where_2_Stay_M
Reviews.Content: The levni is a beautiful new (1 year old) hotel on a quiet side street in the heart of Istanbul. My husband and I stayed there for 6 nights in the first week of September, on a special discounted rate for a standard room booked through bookings.com. It is modern and sleek with a touch of Turkey mixed in. We arrived at the hotel (via a shuttle bus from the airport for 10euros each) and checked in asap. Turkish delight supplied at front desk. Check in was fairly straightforward and relatively quick.Bahri at reception was extremely helpful- he gave us a map of the city and highlighted all the key attractions and the tram line of how to get to them. Ugur took our bags up to our room for us. The standard room was quite small with a double bed,flat screen on the wall, safe, bathrobes and slippers and a complimentary bottle of water. The bathroom had a lovely marble effect (as does 95% of the hotel), shampoo, conditioner, showr cap, soaps, creams and shower. However there was no door! I had read previous reviews of glass doors but this just took the biscuit lol After a quick phone call to Bahri the guest relations manager, UGur was back in our room taking our bags to our new room. Our new room was a lovely deluxe room hidden behind another set of doors eliminating any noise from the hallway. It had a seating area, king size bed, sculptured ceiling light, Turkish lamps and a bigger bathroom with a large bath tub and everything above as listed in the standard room. the bed was amazingly comfortable and although the door to the bathroom was glass it was frosted glass and not completely transparent. Using the hotel wifi I checked on bookings.com and this room was double what we paid for our standard room - so thanks to bahri! We then went on to explore the hotel and the city. To the left of the hotel is a grocery store where you can buy 6 x 1l bottles of water for 5lira and to the right there is a pharmacy and an electrical store where you can buy a travel adapter for 2 lira! At the end of the street(going left) there is a dominoes, mcdonalds and burger king all of which are halal and rates are much cheaper than in London. There are also many, many local Turkish kebab/kofte/donna restaurants where you can eat for as little as 5 lira. My personal favourite is alif bufe a family run cafe which is opposite and to the left of the levni. If you carry on walking (5minutes) you can straight past the galata bridge where you can take the bosphorus cruise for 12lira and into the spice bazar (10minute walk). From here you can also walk to the grand bazar and the suleiman mosque - which is a must see. Personally, I think it is actually better than the blue mosque as it has a peaceful aura about it. If you walk in the other direction of the levni (right direction) you come to the gulhane tram stop. You have to buy a token for 2lira and then you can take the tram (for literally 3minutes/ 2stops) to the blue mosque. From our experience of Istanbul it is extremely congested so if you was to take a car/taxi you would spend most of the day in traffic.We chose to walk to the blue mosque which you can do by either going up a steep hill or along the main normal level street which is dotted with souvenir shops, cafes, ice cream stands etc. We did both over the days and found the journey time from the hotel to be maximum 10-15 minutes walking even whilst stopping to take pictures. The blue mosque, haga Sophia church, topkapi palace, hippodrome and basilica cistern (all must see sights) are all in this region around sultanhmet square. So all in all the levni is in a fantastic location!! My only concern about the location is that the street is nor very well lit at night - but this isn't the hotels fault and actually the hotel is lit and can be seen down the road. Breakfast at the hotel is plentiful. (see pics) there is a variety of cheese an fruit, breads and cake, jams and cereals, eggs and omlettes. I did find the bread and cake were fresh and soft on the first morning and gradually became harder as the week progressed leading me to think it was the same since monday! during my 5 day stay they're were 2 chefs - one for the first 4 mornings and one for the final morning (they must work in shifts as all the waiters had also changed on the 5th day). The chef of the first 4 days is the only reason I would not give the levni a 5 star review. He was rude, did not engage in conversation (but did so with more affluent guests), and on two consecutive mornings said he would make omelettes and bring them over to our table - but instead left them to the side and we had to go collect them ourselves. The chef on the 5th morning was fantastic. He was dishing out food, chatting with guests and ordering all the waiters around. the hotel also has in it's basement a swimming pool (4x10m) -which we used everyday and only on one occasion were there other people in the pool too, a sauna, 2 Turkish baths (a big one for a group of people and an individual one), jacuzzi, gym, spa and acupuncture shower. Just like the rest of the hotel everything is beautifully decorated with scented oils and tea lights, the changing rooms have a shower, lockers, towels, hair dryer, hair gel an soaps. I did notice whilst using the pool other guests of the hotel were being given tours of these facilities and were also being told how to use them (sauna, Turkish bath). This was not something I had experienced so when I asked one of the staff leading the tours how to use the Turkish bath his reply was "you just wash yourself with soap". Hmm, if the facilities weren't so immaculate I would have been a bit insulted. All in all, the hotel is in a fantastic location, with fantastic facilities, rooms and decor. If it weren't for the 2 people I mentioned, customer service would also be 5 star but unfortunately thats what let them down.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: Andreas663
Reviews.Content: The Levni is a wonderful boutique hotel in the Sirkeci/Sultanamet area. My daughter and I stayed there for 7 days at the beginning of September. Our room and bath were immaculate and modern with a touch of "Turkey" thrown in. The view from our deluxe room was breath-taking - the Bosphorous/Golden Horn/Topkapi. The staff was courteous, helpful and always pleasent. The hotel is right in the heart of things with easy access to all the major sites either on foot or by tram which is located right down the block from the hotel. It is walking distance from numerous good restaurants and the hotel restaurant itself is very good. We did not have time to use the spa but did look at it. It is everything the hotel says it is. I hope to use it next time we visit. The hotel is great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: GSES
Reviews.Content: We entered a small lobby with sleek wood and stainless steel. Where we were warmly welcomed by at least six people on staff. Our room was beautifully appointed from the linens, to the walls to the bathroom fixtures. We were able to walk to many tourist venues and were surrounded by good restaurants. The breakfast was a feast both hot and cold. I'd go back to the Levni, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine Break”
Reviews.Author: Rosemaryw11
Reviews.Content: 6 of us just wanted some time away with sunshine and a little culture! Hotel central walking distance of many of sights blue mosque Topkapi Palace Basilica Cistern When you get back from day out there's10 meter pool Turkish bath, sauna, & adventure showers too. They were able to recommend a wonderful fish restaurant with shuttle service and many other good places

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: travmag
Reviews.Content: Location is very good,it is just a few minutes to historical areas..the staff are really helpful,they all show us their hospitality,,The hotel is new and clean.there was a construction near our room outside,we wanted from reception to change our room and they have upgraded us a larger room..They are all smiley faces..I will definitely stay at this hotel when i go to the Ä°stanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many glitches for the money”
Reviews.Author: Constance5
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to this hotel by the expectation of reliability in a location where other hotels sounded interesting but more of a gamble. Proximity to the sights, modern, clean, quiet, a good bed, a good night sleep with the extras of an onsite Turkish bath- sounded like a safe bet for a 40th wedding anniversary and birthday treat. So the problem, pricey for what we got- which ended up being far below expectations for a 4 star. On the minor side, initial room was cramped with poor view. I thought they could do better for us especially since we had booked far in advance and were staying for 8 nights. After one night we got a room change- nicer with a peek of the Bosphorus over construction and expanses of run down roofs. Again minor glitches, no hooks in the bathroom for the robes which we slung over the doors when damp, shower leaked onto the floor requiring all our towels to soak up substantial water, few hangers, no dresser - clothes remained in suitcase. On the positive, comfortable bed, quiet, clean, nice breakfast with accommodating staff. So the problem- day 4 we returned at night hoping to relax in the Turkish bath/sauna, found our key card no longer worked and then after reprogramming the room had not been serviced, the bedspread and decorative pillows were gone, all our wet towels were on the floor and had not been replaced. The front desk sent replacement towels- too late to use the now closed Spa, told us they would identify and straighten out the problem, sent us a small bottle of wine- which we returned we're not drinkers- laughingly told us they would send up some water. Okay. We were ready to let this go. But for the next 3 nights the room was only partially made up- we never saw a bedspread or decorative pillows again, some days there were towels, somedays not. The air conditioner never worked.
