When I asked for an adjustment - we were paying close to $3000 for this booking- was told since our reservation was through Expedia the hotel would not be able to do anything for us. They eventually agreed to cover dinner without alcohol at a nice restaurant. Each of our last 4 nights we missed out on the Spa which closed by the time we got towels, robes or got into the room and talked with front desk. A few items we had bought in the market were missing. To make matters worse when we got home we contacted Expedia who said that they only act as a travel agent and they would have to contact the hotel for any adjustment- which they did and were apparently told nothing could be done because the hotel had no record of any problem! So big bucks for a below bargain rate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location best pick compared to other 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: deema0223
Reviews.Content: we loved the location, in Sultan Ahmet historic area, steps away from the attractions yet a bit tucked away from the crazy busy area. major plus is that it's also steps away from the tram station Gulhane, great way to get to cross over the bay to the newer Takseem area. the hotel is modern, clean, nice batchrooms, new furniture and new fixtures. the swimming pool needs heating. service staff very friendly. breakfast included and convenient. funky arrangement in taking multi elevators to come downstairs, but was not a big deal. overall happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, excellent stuff, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: drtonyukuk
Reviews.Content: Very new and comfortable hotel. Staff was very helpfull. Second time here and the same quality. I will always stay here in istanbul. Thanks for the room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant hotel, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Rayya A
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Levni for 6 nights was fantastic. The hotel staff made our stay a memorable one; they are extremely welcoming, helpful and genuine. I liked them very much. The hotel is well situated in Sultanahmet and we found that we had easy access to many desirable areas by foot. The breakfast was very nice; the quality of the food was good and the decor in the restaurant was very pleasing. We will definately stay here again when we come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Levni was wonderful it felt like we had arrived in a very special place...”
Reviews.Author: Darrianne
Reviews.Content: The Levni is situated in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul, we were returning back to Istanbul after two weeks in the fabulous Greek Islands, our previous hotel in Istanbul we did not like as it was small and noisy so we asked our travel agent to find us a five star close to the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar and when we arrived at the Levni it was beautiful. The room was large and the bed a king size, the bathroom was marble and the products were great to use everyday. The breakfast room was sunny and the food divine especially with the chef cooking your eggs anyway you wanted them. Our guest relations Anna was extremely helpful and a really lovely lady. The staff at the front desk were helpful even when the WI FI went down they offered me their own computer to work on. We would highly recommend the Levni for the location and the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, family of 5 staying in the Suite”
Reviews.Author: andimate
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff, looked after us for the 2 nights we stayed in Istanbul. We are a family of 5, the three children being 3,3 & 5. The location was perfect, close enough for us to walk to the Blue Mosque and jump a sightseeing bus from there. Word of warning - there are doors in the suite that open to nothing (only a 5 storey drop), literally. With kids we did not like this but the hotel came to the room and locked the doors and removed all the handles, securing the doors. The room was very good, modern, open plan with large jacuzzi and great views over the Bosphorus. Breakfast was simple and sufficient, nothing fancy but nothing left wanting. Overall a very good experience and I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Levni!”
Reviews.Author: ela127
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in Sultanahmet. It is a bit disjointed because it seems to be built on two adjoining properties but really no problem once you get the hang of it. Breakfast is generous and clean. Free wifi in the hotel and two computers are available for your use in the business center, free of charge. The highlight is the staff. They are among the most friendly and accomodating I have seen, always ready to go the extra mile with a smile. If I am lucky enough to go to Istanbul again, I will again stay at the Levni. Tip: There are a lot of one way streets around. If you are going to cab back to the hotel from anywhere, take a small map with the hotel's location on it (at front desk) to show to your taxi driver. It makes things easier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlexWongSg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Will definitely stay here again. Breakfast is free and has a very nice spread with a happy cook that makes pancakes and omlettes and talks to you about life in turkey. Polite and cheerful, friendly staff but gave us wrong directions for one or two places- after a while we stopped asking them for directions. Nicely decorated and clean rooms. Very classy with a beautiful toilet. King sized and very comfortable bed- which is the first we saw out of 4 or so hotels in turkey. The air- conditioning however was a bit haywire and kept resetting itself to 24 degrees despite our best attempts to set it at a warmer temperature. Once it randomly turned off and wouldnt turn on again and had to call hotel reception to turn it on remotely. Free turkish bath! which was a very nice touch

Reviews.Title: “We had the best time.......”
Reviews.Author: Alexia T
Reviews.Content: There's nothing negative we could say about this hotel. its location was very convinient since it is located in the historical area of Sultanahmet near Agia Sofia and the tram station. Regarding the hotel service and facilities, we were very pleased with the kindness of the staff, who were always more than willing to help us with anything we needed. The breakfast was very good with a variety of foods. The rooms very comfortable and quite luxurius. We were also quite surprised with the spa facilities, where we spent some nice relaxed evenings. Thank you Birhan and Cerkan for making our stay in your beautiful city so comfortable and fun.... We will definetely come back!

Reviews.Title: “One Of Our Best Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Amal P
Reviews.Content: I and my wife had been to Istanbul for the first time and we are resident of Dubai, our expectations was no less than a 5 to 7 star experience, but surprisingly Levni - the 5 star boutique gave not only the experience of a 5 star hotel but also with the warmth of the hotel staff hospitality it was a truly amazing experience. we stayed for 4 days experiences the hotel Breakfast, Dinner, SPA, Pool, it was wonderful experience and the 2nd day was my birthday when my wife wanted to give a surprise to me by ordering a cake from the hotel, but to our surprise the whole birthday delight with cake and wine was presented to us by the house, this was just amazing. When we were leaving the hotel the hotel manager Ms. Evlan had presented a very nice portrait as a gift to my wife and this was just another nice surprise the hotel gave. My communication was with the owner of the hotel Mr. Cetin - A truly amazing personality and a very nice person, hats off to him for keeping the hotel and his staff high on giving personal touch to their customers. I wish Levni to spread more branches in Turkey as well as Internationally, regards, Amal

Reviews.Title: “"stylish and fresh with outstanding customer service"”
Reviews.Author: peter_john32
Reviews.Content: A new hotel perfectly located and a great place to unwind and relax. The hotel has everything you want/need with great facilities. The many staff were very attentive and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: mid-midtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value. The room and bath were extremely clean (seemed brand new) and beautifully appointed. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast even included an omelet bar and pots of western style coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Comfort +”
Reviews.Author: tiago_trip
Reviews.Content: At first I was impressed with the attention of the hotel manager commenting on a bad review of the hotel, right here on TripAdvisor. This certainly helped me choose amongst other possible alternatives. When I arrived for my 2 nights stay I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is very well located, only 8/10 minutes walk from Hagia Sophia, Sultan Ahmed Mosque and little longer walk to the Grand Bazaar. The hotels interior architecture is a bit strange: you have to take two elevators to get to your room (from the main entrance) but it makes sense since there is another entrance from another street level. The staff is friendly (although most of them should train their English), the rooms are very comfortable (complete with Grohe bathroom fittings and Duravit ceramics), there is a large Philips LCD TV and the very important bed is good and comfortable, although the sheets could be better. We had a Hamam Bath in the Spa, which was incredible. after a morning of meetings and an afternoon of walking all over town it was like being reborn. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will probably repeat my stay when I return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, beautiful rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Maryvdh68
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we did not regret it! When you travel to Istanbul, location is key. I would recommend everyone to stay at this hotel or near to it. You can walk to the main attractions and restaurants and you have a tram stop on the corner of the hotel. This is worth so much. We really think it is a must to stay in the historic part of town. The rooms of this hotels were great, very modern and comfortable. The lobby is not that impressive. The breakfast was fine, no the best we have experienced but just good enough. The service at the hotel, however, was excellent. Everyone was so pleasant and the manager was on top of everything. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shsamir
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel .... Friendly staff and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Levni. It is a wonderful hotel. We had booked a Deluxe room and were delighted that it had a fantastic view across through the straights into the Bosphorus. The room was a good size and the bed was really comfortable and the staff were fantastic and tried very hard to make our stay enjoyable. Breakfast was good and i had a Turkish Bath and a massage. Both were terrific and so i would also recommend the spa. We also had dinner in the restaurant one night and enjoyed the 'Grill Night' As other reviewers have noted, all of the major attractions in the old city are within 5 or 10 minutes walk. We have just booked an Executive room for a return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: alaskafaa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews and were not disappointed in any way. There were a few little issues, just like any place. However, both times I called the front desk about something, it was resolved quickly. The hotel is modern and new, rooms were big for European standards (we were in 1204) and the entire hotel was spotless. The staff made the trip though...waitstaff in the restaurant (breakfast is all we did here) was great. Very professional and the food was top notch! This was not just a continental breakfast but a buffet that left us satisfied till well after lunchtime. All major tourist sites within a five minute walk .so this was a great location. For $225 per night (taxes, breakfast etc included) this was a good value for us. If you book it, you can rest assured that you will have nothing to worry about upon arriving at the Levni. Oh, and my 4 year old daughter loved swimming in the pool everyday. It was clean, cool, and a bit small, but really perfect for a refreshing dip. Book the Levni!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted in a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lehuakea
Reviews.Content: Large beautiful rooms and bathrooms, fabulous staff, perfect location, impeccable service, a breakfast buffet that offers everything one could want--and then some. My friend and I, never having traveled to Istanbul, were trying to decide between the Levni and another top-rated hotel--and we were so glad we chose the Levni! I am a stickler for a good night's sleep (interestingly, this is not always available at some popular hotels) and the Levni offers super comfortable beds, sound-proof walls and windows, and window shades that fully block light. I slept well and woke up rested and ready for each day. The location is perfect; walking distance to the major sights, the harbor, public transportation, restaurants, etc. The staff is friendly and professional. As seasoned travelers know, a hotel is all about the staff--they make or break the experience. These folks are pros in the most complimentary sense of the word. Thank you Levni!

Reviews.Title: “Well organized, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sa7toot
Reviews.Content: We moved from Antalya to Istanbul and stayed at Levni. We got two connected rooms for me, my wife and 3 childrens. The rooms were smallers than expected,specially the toilets. However, The staff we great and helpful. You will always see a smile, or hear a "Good morning". They also help you with any tour or reservation in resturants / night clubs that you may inquire about. The breakfast buffet was fine, however, it was the same for 3 days. The resturant staff were also great, specially their manager. The hotel is between the Sultanahmet and other sightseeings. Only and walking distance from everything that you should see in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: Passage1333
Reviews.Content: Facilities are quite nice, breakfast great, location tourist-friendly, but outstanding service by all staff was the highlight for us. Only drawback was street noise, common in this part of city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stephJanes
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband we had a great stay at the levni hotel. We both are hotel professionals and able to see the details. It is clearly the management makes his job very well, I was impressed about the service level offered by the Levni Hotel. The Front Desk Manager and the Elwon did a great service, the manager took care about all the issues we had and solved most personally. The Waiter Baris was very friendly. Thank you to all. The hotel is just perfect with the location and the stylish rooms, all is new and nice. Food was excellent, but the juice at the breakfast is not good at all. The construction in front of the hotel is noisy time to time. We had to wait long for the taxi. but overall I would strongly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and a Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KatySmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights in June. One of the reasons why we chose this hotel is because it is very close to all the main attractions: Topkapi Palace is only 5 mins walking distance and the taxi to the Taxim square was only 17 tl...not bad at all. The service at the hotel was very good; I personally would give 6 stars to the hotel just because of the special personalized service that we had pleasure to receive from the General Manager! He made our day twice! Having stayed in many hotels in my life, I can say that it is not often at all that General Manager himself bothers to interact with guests on this level. Definitely one of the best General Managers and a fantastic hotel! Guest Relations and Front Office is simply superb - many thanks to all stuff who made our stay so enjoyable and worry-free. Should we have a chance to return to Istanbul again, we know we have our home away from home now. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “could do much better”
Reviews.Author: danromeo
Reviews.Content: This is a three star hotel in a - nearly - four star building, in a run-down street but close enough to the main attractions. All in all it is an example of how not to run the business somebody put a lot of money into. The hotel is a year old, quite labyrinthic, and has some correctly sized rooms and others that are quite small. No views whatsoever, traffic noise on the lower floors. We had three rooms for a week, in one of them the airco did not work, another did not have a minibar, a third had an airco that only blasted at full speed, directly at the bed, and no change of temperature possible (after getting a service person to the room three times without success, I gave up). The shower handles were loose and fell off, the bathroom scale was broken, the rug stained... Room was not made until late in the afternoon, on the 3rd day at 20.00 hrs only after we complained, on the 5th day when we came back at nearly midnight we found it was not made at all. The front desk was friendly but did not resolve anything. Breakfast is extensive but the bread is not up to standard and the fruit juices are horrendous. Ask for a fresh orange juice and they 'll charge you 10 TL (7 US$, 5.50 euros). Dinner (in the breakfast room) was not nice and overpriced. The hotel needs a tougher manager, could be nice enough. Should be, for their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Husainym
Reviews.Content: it is well furnitued and excellent services, we loved it and we recommend others to stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very helpful staff, value for manoey”
Reviews.Author: Artemy
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the three components, spa facilities are somewhat basic, but overall enjoyed quite much

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a very fair rate”
Reviews.Author: fabriziofiorucci
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good restaurant with a lot of different choices at a strategic location to visit Sultanhamet. Just 400m from Aya Sofia and the blue mosque and 15 minutes on foot from the spice market. Very gentle staff, english spoken.

Reviews.Title: “The Levni Hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: mauigp
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Incredibly hospitable, knowledgeable, responsive staff. The guest relations women made all the difference to our trip. Modern design. LARGE, comfortable rooms. Wonderful spa and gorgeous swimming pool. Fantastic breakfast buffet. Exceptional service. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: aliasmalu
Reviews.Content: Great location! Only Â½ block from Gulhane Tram Station. Short walk (although there are a lot of cobblestone streets and hills so wear comfortable shoes!!) to Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofiya, Basilica Cistern. This hotel is fairly new so snatch it up now before everyone discovers it! Room was nice and they provide you with a robe and slippers during your stay. A little confusing getting to our room at first b/c its 2 separate buildings so you have to take 2 separate elevators to get to your room. Had a friend come to our hotel and she was waiting in one lobby while we were in the other. The room numbering system can be a little confusing ie room # 1301 is the 3rd floor and when u got to 3rd floor there were a short set of stairs to get to your room. Which is fine if you donâ€™t have luggage. Minibar in room which is nice to keep water cold. Free large bottled water was provided on 3 out of our 6 days there. Free wifi which you can access in your room also. Turkish delight at the lobby desk. Breakfast was excellent with made to order omelettes and pancakes. I thought the staff was very friendly and everyone tried to address your concerns and make you feel welcome. The manager was also very pleasant and helpful. Hotel Sultania- make a right out of hotel and then its one of the streets on the left but you will see the sign for the CafÃ©. Offers free apple tea at the end of the meal Would recommend getting the jetons- tokens for the tram, bus, subway or if you can find where they sell it- the Akbil which multiple people can use and you can recharge it. Topkapi Palace â€“ 20 lira I liked the treasury room with all the jewels!! They had an 86 karat diamond in there!!(Harem is inside the palace but charges a separate entrance to get in 15 lira- this was the living quarters of the sultans and concubines. Had nice tilework inside but not sure it was worth having a separate price of admission for) Grand Bazaar- do haggle them- they expect it. Some places take credit card (esp for larger purchases). Some take dollars and euros too. There are many places that sell pashminas so shop around for selection, quality and price. Jewelry is very nice here also. They are big into 22k gold and even if you donâ€™t get this at the grand bazaar in the jewelry district you can usu get 10-20% off what they quote you at some places. Bircan is a nice place and a pretty good selection (in Nuruosomaniye area). On the way to the Grand Bazaar you may pass this district of jewelry stores in Nuruosomaniye. Nar Gourmet Restaurant- located on the top floor of the Argamman jewelry store in Nuruosomaniye. Good food, warm bread and reasonable prices. Also along this same street is : Khave Desani- good for coffees and desserts. Good prices Worth a trip to the Asian side â€“ you can get a ferry to the Asian side from Emononu. Ciya Sofrasi is a good place to start for the appetizers and Ciya Kebab right across the street for items with meat. Streets are not labeled but easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “The best small hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: thek9sbllx
Reviews.Content: Thgis hotel is simply amazing....such comfort and luxury and yet right in the heart of the old city....rooms are spacious and very clean. Upgrade to deluxe room meant beautiful views over the Bosphorous...all the staff are attentive, welcoming and only to eager to help. Spa and swimming pool a definite plus as is the wonderful restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Once at Levni, Always at Levni”
Reviews.Author: azeeznarain
Reviews.Content: Take out a map of the Sultanahmet area in Istanbul and draw a line connecting all the important places you'd like to visit - Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, Galata Bridge, Cagaloglu. You'll end up drawing a loop with Levni Hotel sitting pretty right in its center - that's how well it is located! The rooms are tastefully done, striking the right balance between traditional colours, patterns and contemporary international aesthetics. The breakfast buffet is exceptionally good with enough choice even for vegans...Its laid out in a glass box which gets warm morning sunshine and sets you up for a packed touristy day at Istanbul. All in all, full marks to Levni for making out Istanbul trip so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomended - couldn't say a bad word about it”
Reviews.Author: SeasoneTraveller75
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Levni met all our expections. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable. The spa facilities were great. We really enjoyed the food. The buffet breakfasts provided a wide range of fruit, cereals, breads and hot meals. We also ate lunch at the restaurant and it was as good if not better than other places we ate in Istanbul, and the prices were very reasonable. The hotel is ideally located right near Topaki Palace, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We walked to all the sights and restaurants. If you stay at Levni I would recommend dining on the roof terrace at Mozaik/Rumeli (the two restaurants have now combined). It's 5 mins away and serves excellent food. Overall a great experience - thanks Levni!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, New Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: max_d1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with small children - had booked 2 deluxe interconnected rooms but fell in love with the King Suite with open bathroom, walk-in closet, and unbeatable-panoramic views of old city and Bosphorous. The hotel is less than a year old with 5 minute walk to Spice Market and less than 10 minute walk to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace and Ayasofya. Spa is quite nice for a boutique hotel. Breakfast and restaurant are average/as expected for a boutique hotel. My only criticism is that the Reception could have been more knowledgeable/helpful and we missed having a "Concierge" that you would find in larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: momo11Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is walking distance to tram and most of the main attractions. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Could not ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: Davidone
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel on the back of positive reviews here (and wild over-pricing by Hilton and Sheraton, my usual choices) and was not disappointed. Really handy for the tram - Gulhane stop is 400 metres from the hotel, next to the sports bar - and lots of decent places to eat, small convenience stores, etc all on hand. The spa was great, I recommend the hammam - it may be a tourist cliche but is a great experience. Staff were really good, with excellent English which compensated for my almost total lack of ability with Turkish beyond the basic pleasantries. The room was compact but it is a boutique hotel in 2 converted Ottoman houses, and good use was made of the available space. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Modern Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: nsmnsm
Reviews.Content: The Levni is a smart, modern hotel in/near the Sultanahmet area. Very convenient to walk and experience the sights and sounds of the old city. Many nice eating places within walking distance all around. It does not have a view like the hotels overlooking the Bosphorus would. But you are there to be in the heart of the city. We were travelling with two kids (ages 9 and 13) and were in a Duplex Room. It was on two levels with the bathroom upstairs. It was comfortable. We especially enjoyed the large desk and small kitchenette. The bathroom did not have a door which becomes difficult when sharing the room with kids. The staff at reception were exceptional - very friendly, especially Bahri and Elwan. Cetin who handled our email bookings was efficient too. The General Manager was very open to feedback for improving anything we were not happy with. He organised fruit salad for us, when I said I missed sufficient variety in fresh fruit at breakfast. We had some issue with housekeeping - when I did not find the bathroom cleaned well, and when we found a giant fly in the room. However he did take it up with housekeeping and we had no problem after that. The restaurant staff at breakfast were very good and the free tea/cakes in the evenings was a nice touch. All in all, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BBeisty
Reviews.Content: It was my 50th birthday and I had the best time. The hotel was great; very relaxed atmosphere. Friendly staff. Fabulous view from my room. The rooms were lovely, spacious and clean. Great location. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!... EXCELLENT!...”
Reviews.Author: secreen
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, great service, normal prices, friendly staff. The hospitality extended to us during our stay at this hotel is excellent. This has undoubtedly been one of my best stays & the property is maintained well. Their courteous staff & the care & their team extended to me was par excellence. The spa was nice, rooms very comfortable and clean. I was very sutisfied with my stay and would certainly looking to come there soon with my family... Best wishes from Vietnam...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AngelaGafney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday and I can't praise the staff and hotel facilities enough. The rooms were really nice with great views and the staff made sure all our rooms were close by. It is is in a great location within walking distance of most of the main attractions. The hotel staff were always helpful, cheerful and friendly and helped organise our transport for the evenings. The staff even organised a birthday cake for my sister. I would definitely stay there again and you won't be disappointed if you decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Smiley, attentive, caring professional staff and 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: CityVisitor3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel during our Bank Holiday weekend. This was our first visit to Istanbul and we reall y enjoy both historical and fun side of this magnificient city. Staff was very courteous, helpfull and always have can do attitude whic is very rare to find even big brands in novadays. Even Hotel General Manager greeted us one morning and give soem good tips to make most of this great city. Staff is really great credit to this hotel and all I can say is keep up good work! I highly recommend this hotel to everybody who would like to explore Istanbul and its secrets while having a five star service and value for money at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay,apprreciate the hospitality of the staff,exellent location.”
Reviews.Author: margaretbeisty
Reviews.Content: We came to Istanbul from Manchester to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday,initially we chose Levni hotel becouse of the location,when we reached the hotel,we were very happy to see a very modern and clean hotel,our rooms all had bosphrous view on the 4th floor,,clean and large rooms with large flat screen tvs.hotel staff were very friendly and helpful,specially to mention Miss Nalan and Mr. Bahri and all staff.The location was so convenient,we visited Topkapi Museum, Suleymania Mosque,Ayasofia,and closed Market ,Sultan Ahmet area,all is in a short walk from the Hotel.there is an Irish pub close by and loads of good shops and restaurants in Sultan Ahmet,we enyoyed our stay very much,and left with good memories and we all wanted to come again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every aspect!!!”
Reviews.Author: lexus07Chicago
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed for 7 wonderful nights at the Levni. We only have positve things to say about this Hotel. Perfect location for all the sites. The staff was professional and extremely friendly and helpful. The Hotel is new so the rooms were very nice and more spacious than we expected. If we ever returned to Istanbul we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: albr71
Reviews.Content: yes, it was a good choice! I did not know this hotel and have chosen also based on the comments on Tripadvisor. I'm not disappointed. It's a nice hotel, a bit strange since it's made of 2 separate buildings (meaning you have to take 2 elevators to move from one place to the other... not a big deal...). The room is nice and quite, although the bathroom is a bit small. I have to highlight that at my arrival the AC was not working and after no more than 30 minutes I had a technician and a manager in my room repairing it. This is good service! It had a nice breakfast area and restaurant. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: iord
Reviews.Content: It is a new hotel with very nice rooms. The location of this hotel is very close to historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, absolutely outstanding in everything:Staff & service, room , Spa and location.”
Reviews.Author: LamiaSakr
Reviews.Content: Actually, everything was really very good. The deluxe room was really nice with great view. The staff is so friendly and their service level is outstanding. Food is really good whether it is breakfast or dinner.The Spa offers a wide range of treatment, I've tried a few and they were all good. Last but not least, the location is just perfect: few steps away from everything. I just can't wait to come back again. It is the perfect romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff making the family feel like home”
Reviews.Author: ukranova
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old kid and myself stayed for 5 nights in this hotel, picked by location and price and the fact it has a swimming pool and spa center. Overall, we had a great time at the hotel. We would first of all like to thank all the staff, but especially Huseyin and Baris for being so kind to us, and especially our kid during our stay there. We would also like to thank Mr. Serkan for his time to chat with us between his duties as general manager on the hotel. We had a nice room, large enough for us three. However, the room is not practical for families with kids as the glass door on the bathroom did not provide the privacy needed and also was a danger to the kid. Constant slamming of the service personnell door next to our room was not nice to listen to, especially during the nap time for the kid. There were no view from the room, as we only could see the brick wall of restauration of next door building, but we have to admit, we did not come for the view from the room, but to have easy access to sights outside the room, so it did not matter to us at all, but for those who appreciate a room view should ask for room with view in this hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect, as it is walking distance to the Egyptian market, Spanish Market and the Grand basar with the spice market. It is also in walking distance to the 2 larger mosques in the old city and a great restaurant street only 10 minutes walking from the hotel. A tips to the hotel management (and not a critizism to the hotel): A warning should be given to all its guests by the reception personell at check-in that taxi should be ordered through the hotel in order to avoid being ripped off by the cab drivers. We experienced one greedy taxi driver which charged us double of the normal fare price, so we recommend asking for a taxi in the lobby at any given time. We certainly will make this our regular place to stay when we go to Istanbul every 3 months, and will highly recommend the place to anyone visiting Itanbul. We had a very nice time at the hotel, and enjoyed the food in the restaurant and at breakfast. Our kid had a lovely time as he got spoiled by the personnell and could enjoy a daily swim in a nice atmosphere and intimate swimming pool area in the basement. Extra cot bed was provided by the staff upon arrival, and the kid slept like an angel during the night. We highly recommend the place and you will not be dissapointed by the location, service and style of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mehpek
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel has a great athmosphere with good location and cheerefull staff. they were very kind and helped us during all our holiday. the hotel is very close to historical places which takes no more that 10 minutes and also we could easly use all public transportation. Spa that we really liked and I definetely will come for the fabulous massage :) when we heard the hotel was new we couldnt believe it, because they had already settled everything perfectly. thank you so much to all and will definetely go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraT
Reviews.Content: When we decided to travel to Istanbul for the Shopping Festival, we wanted to find a nice and neat hotel, with all the amenities needed in order to relax and have fun without paying a fortune. And that's what Levni hotel offered to us! Clean, nice rooms. Very helpful and always smiling staff, always willing to help us! My hubbie enjoyed the turkish bath and we both had the best travelling experience. I would recomend Levni Hotel & spa to all my friends traveling to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Solid place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigScooter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights on our recent trip to Istanbul. We picked it based on price and location and stayed in a standard room. Service was fine. Anything beyond the basics (check in, check out, taxi to the airport please) were not possible - for example recommendations for dinner or walking directions to the Galata Tower were not able to be provided to English speakers like us. Overall the room, food, gym, location, and free wifi were all acceptable. Nothing fantastic, but we didn't travel to Istanbul in search of a fabulous hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very good new hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmasingerroberts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Levni for one night at the beginning of our trip around Turkey. We are a young professional couple who have travelled around the world and have stayed at various 5 star hotels. The hotel website is good and quite accurate. The location is good, although there were a lot of roadworks in the area (not the hotel's fault). This hotel is sleek and looks impeccable, lots of marble everywhere. The rooms are lovely - very nicely done and all the comforts are there. However, we arrived at 1400, quite tired, and had to wait a further 1.5 hours for our room which had not yet been cleaned. We did not complain (but had to ask whether our room was ready several times) and later that evening, the hotel, unprompted, sent us wine and fruit to our room as an apology. I do believe that the staff are friendly and very helpful, and would go out of their way to help. However, in situations like this, perhaps offering tea and a wider spread of biscuits (than the single biscuit which we got) would have sufficed as we were very hungry when we arrived and strong Turkish tea is not necessarily good on an empty stomach! Breakfast was fine, a buffet with a fairly wide spread. I do however agree with one reviewer who commented that the wait staff appeared disorganised. The hotel was not full when we stayed and from their slowness in responding to requests, I dont think that the staff would be able to cope with busy periods. Glad to see that this hotel is getting good reviews, it deserves it. For prospective guests, I would suggest being wary of reviews which claim false advertising (yes, you 'BeSafe2011' from San Francisco) and accusations of unsafe rooms. The hotel's answer is interesting, and having experienced the hotel, believe their response. Litigous American culture has a lot to answer for, and be ashamed of.

Reviews.Title: “Like a magic!!”
Reviews.Author: antoniosurv
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really convenient. So close to the historical places where Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and St. Sophia are located. We received a very good service from the staff. They were so polite,friendly and caring of the guests in house. Thanks for to the management.

Reviews.Title: “poetic view, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: drtonyukuk
Reviews.Content: We felt like a star in this beautiful hotel. The view was incredible. The service was very fast. The staff were very helpfull. The price was high but it was well worth it. Istanbul is very beautiful. Thanx Levni !

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinaire - Splendid”
Reviews.Author: pbowry
Reviews.Content: Despite a poor Meet & Greet arranged thru Gap Adventures, Toronto and their counterparts Dijon Travel Istanbul based on a private tour of Turkey we arrived at Pre booked Hotel Levni with a lot of skepticism. We were checked in with a lot of warmth and hearing our plight the Hotel decided to upgrade our Standard Room. The Staff at this 5* Hotel is simply amazing. Right from Bahri on the Front Desk to Elvan in Guest Relations to Ã‡etin Koca their Manager Business Development, these folks were constantly looking out for our satisfaction despite the fact that the Hotel was full. .. They truly made us feel wanted & appreciated our business. Complimentary Wines & Fruit Baskets were never out of the Ordinary. Truly a Home Away from Home. We are sure to come back. Well Done Levni.

Reviews.Title: “Levni is making your stay in Istanbul a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Wietske1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Levni Hotel & Spa for three nights. Staff was very professional and friendly. Breakfast abundant and fresh. Room was close to construction site (no work in progress though) but staff was willing to upgrade us to another (bigger) room further away. Rooms were quite and very clean as well as the spa facilities. Location perfect for first time visitors; walking distance to mayor tourist attractions. Price is descent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: pam-brussels
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a four day stay with my partner at the Levni Hotel. I chose this hotel because of all the positive reviews I read on Trip Advisor however I must say I have mixed feelings about our experience. I'll start with the positives: the location of the hotel is fantastic; the hotel is clean, new and modern with nice decor; there's a spa centre where you have free access to the sauna, pool and gym (treatments/massages are extra but at a reasonable price); our transfers to and from the airport were organised and on time; staff at the front desk reception are helpful, made recommendations, booked restaurants, tours etc., the breakfast is good with cold and warm options. On the negative side: - our room was really small, it looked out onto a wall, the 'bathroom' was separated from the bed by a sliding mirror and the toilet was in a tiny cubicle, it wasn't an ugly looking room because as I said the decor is nice and they did the best with the space available, but having paid Eur 200 a night I expected a bit better; - the spa is one of the strong points of the hotel, we had a massage on one day and enjoyed it, so there and then, we asked the lady at the spa reception desk to book us another hamman treatment for our last evening. We were looking forward to it and when we arrive there they said they couldn't find our reservation and so we didn't get our treatment. Never understood what went wrong. However both ladies who we spoke to at the spa reception desk (on different days) could barely communicate in English or explain what the treatments on offer consist of, so I think the problem may lie there. - the staff in the breakfast room need to be more organised, I don't know if it's a matter of being understaffed but I think it's more a matter of being managed better, on one of the days we waited 15 minutes seated at a dirty table (all available tables were dirty) before one of the them cleared the dirty plates, and on all days you got your coffee when you had almost finished your bfast. - other visitors mentioned that the hotel made excellent recommendations for restaurants. Well basically they have 4 or 5 brochures for different restos which include a free transfer to and from the resto. We went to the Balik Restaurant under the Galata Bridge and had a mediocre meal for over Eur 200 for 2 ppl. The other nights we followed lonely planet recommendations and had excellent meals. I don't want to be negative, I thought I would write also about the negative aspects of our experience to avoid others having as high expectations as we had and then being disappointed. Maybe we were just unlucky. I do think on the whole this is a good hotel but there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice- a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Nana2011_11
Reviews.Content: We did not know the hotel nor did we get any recommendation about it. we booked through Internet and we are very glad we did. It is extremely well located for the typical touristic attractions (all of them within walking distance), it is clean and modern and has great Spa facilities. Above all, more importantly, the reception staff were very kind and professional, and they helped us with restaurant reservations, giving us always the best advice and we managed tables at the best places in the city. I recommend it to anyone !!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: Norman65
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Levni hotel with a group of friends. Excellent hotel when you want to stay in the centre of Istanbul with all gr8 attractions including public transport within walkin distance. Don't hesitate to take the metro or lightrail to get to your destination. It's cheap, save and clean. But it can be crowded. The staff is very friendly and helpfull and very eger to provid you the best service . They can and will help you when you want to explore the city. We surely can recommend the spa including massage. I wpuld visit the hotel again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: goudas
Reviews.Content: Nice welcome , good information, nice and caring staff Everything worked very well: rooms were very nice and silent,wounderfoul spa and breakfast was good. Excellent service! All places are in walking distance thank you very much

Reviews.Title: “nice place to rest and relax”
Reviews.Author: ank06
Reviews.Content: the noise level was the only problem i faced. all other things were perfect. especially the spa services cleared me of the tiredness of the fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline190445
Reviews.Content: Hotel slick and luxurious. Perfectly situation for all sites, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Cistern (impressive), Grand Bazzar, Spice Bazzar. Everything within walking distance but tram is there if you need to conserve energy. Street hotel is on looks a bit rundown but only minutes from bars and restaurants. Spa offers hamman, wonderful experience! Make sure you try it and allow enough time. Breakfast offers great choice, try everything! Men wanting to be your personal tour guide are irritating and constant especially if you are a woman travelling alone. Some very persistent! Top marks to Develi Restaurant for mezze and kebabs and Galata Villa for fish, both gorgeous places on Asian side. Ferry easy to negotiate and trip is worth making. Galata Bridge perfect location for a drink, sun downer or lunch. Galata Tower has fantastic views over city as long as you have a head for heights!

Reviews.Title: “Very smart hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ViewFromTheAbbey
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is very smart and has been finished to a high standard. After a bad start due to a technical problem with our room, we were upgraded to an executive room for our second night. This room was superb wih a great view. Spa facility was very clean and smart. Breakfast was very good. Very little atmosphere in restaurant in evening so we did not eat dinner in house...not a problem as there are lots of nice dining options within an easy walk. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Would recommend this place and would definitely go back if in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: EBRUERDEM
Reviews.Content: Levni hotel was recommended to me by one of my business partners.It was a wonderful hotel and I had a good experience during my stay.Facilities were very good and the service was professional and friendly. I stayed in a standard room but its like a delux room.Wireless worked very fast.Room was very clean and quiet. Dinner in the hotel was also very delicious. I visited spa center to be relax.Acknowledge spa staff to magic hands.It's gorgeous!!! Every guests should be try Turkish Bath,massage and skincare treatments:))

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beatiful city!!”
Reviews.Author: MarionMemo
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, close to a lot of highlights of Istanbul. We had a great time in the Levni Hotel!! Our compliments to receptionist Serdar. He is very friendly, always smiling and he speaks good english. When we come to Istanbul again then definetely we go back to the Levni Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: WonderfWorldWanderer
Reviews.Content: Fresh Hotel, in excelent location, very helpfull staff, nice food, attrective designed rooms, magnificany view to the see, definitly very GOOD hotel, I highly recccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: likeholidays23
Reviews.Content: I was travellaling with my boyfriend and we stay in this hotel for a few days. It was realy nice there, the room were very clean, it was beautiful and a romantic atmosphere. Tthe hotel is situated very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dingsda16
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, personel is serviable and knowledgable. Everything is very clean and general state of furniture is new. Perfect not only for holiday, but also for business trips as infrastructure is there. Very central situation, ideal for visiting the town with its curiosities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent architecture, horrible administration”
Reviews.Author: Allyonnia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, modern design, hip style decoration, unskilled staff, poor administration, below average food and kitchen. Looser by default. Should focus on the service quality. And a last remark: elevator noise prevent a seamless sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality - every need catered for”
Reviews.Author: ADzU
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my partner and was very impressed. Very swanky hotel - very clean with helpful and friendly staff. We were made to feel very welcome. Location ideal for making the most of a short break

HotelInfo.Name: Levni Hotel & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Ebussud Cad. Nr. 31 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
